p:
Microbial pathogens are responsible for more than 400 million years of life lost annually across the globe, a higher burden than either cancer or cardiovascular disease
1 . Diseases that have long plagued humanity, such as malaria and tuberculosis, continue to impose a staggering toll. Recent decades have also witnessed the emergence of new virulent pathogens, including human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), Ebola virus, severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus, West Nile virus and Zika virus.
